thread.title: Man United transfer news: Kevin Gameiro 'angry' at Diego Simeone | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man United transfer news: Kevin Gameiro 'angry' at Diego Simeone | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man United transfer news: Kevin Gameiro 'angry' at Diego Simeone | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 2:42 pm Gameiro was unimpressed (Picture: Getty) 
Kevin Gameiro has revealed he was angry at Diego Simeone for being substituted during Atletico Madrid’s Champions League clash with Bayer Leverkusen. 
The 29-year-old striker was visibly upset at being taken off midway through the second half of the La Liga side’s 4-2 win over Bayer Leverkusen after scoring his side’s third goal. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Gameiro netted from the spot just before the hour mark but was withdrawn, much to his fury, in the 71st minute. 
His actions have fuelled speculation he could be set to leave the Spanish capital in the summer, with Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur both believed to be keen to land him. Gameiro was angry with Simeone (Picture: Bongarts/Getty) 
But despite revealing he was ‘angry’ at being subbed off, Gameiro insisted the decision was Simeone’s to make. 
‘Yes, I was angry because you want to play the whole match when you’re playing well,’ he told Marca.
